summary: The Warehouse Worker Protection Act aims to establish protections for warehouse workers by amending existing labor laws and OSHA standards. Key provisions include establishing a Fairness and Transparency Office within the Department of Labor, protecting workers from unfair quotas and workplace surveillance, enhancing OSHA standards for musculoskeletal disorders and medical treatment delays, and increasing enforcement mechanisms. The bill also addresses retaliation against workers and the role of the National Labor Relations Board regarding quotas.
